story.translation: Perfect, I'll have one of those. Do you also have wines?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Sí, tenemos una selección de vinos blancos y tintos. ¿Te interesa alguno?
story.translation: Yes, we have a selection of white and red wines. Are you interested in any?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Una copa de vino tinto, por favor. ¿Qué snacks recomiendas?
story.translation: A glass of red wine, please. What snacks do you recommend?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Las aceitunas y el queso manchego van muy bien con el vino tinto.
story.translation: Olives and Manchego cheese go very well with red wine.

lesson.title: Asking Someone on a Date
introduction: This lesson unfolds a scenario where one individual expresses interest in going out on a date with another. It encompasses expressions of interest, making invitations, and responding politely.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Hola, ¿tienes planes para este fin de semana?
story.translation: Hi, do you have plans for this weekend?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: No, aún no tengo planes. ¿Por qué?
story.translation: No, I don't have plans yet. Why?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Me preguntaba si te gustaría ir a cenar conmigo.
story.translation: I was wondering if you would like to have dinner with me.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Eso suena genial. Me encantaría.
story.translation: That sounds great. I would love to.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: ¿Qué te parece si nos encontramos a las ocho en el restaurante La Estrella?
story.translation: How about we meet at eight at La Estrella restaurant?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Perfecto, nos vemos el sábado entonces.
story.translation: Perfect, see you on Saturday then.

tests.prompt: do you have plans for this weekend?
tests.answer: ¿tienes planes para este fin de semana?

tests.prompt: How about we meet at eight
tests.answer: ¿Qué te parece si nos encontramos a las ocho

lesson.title: Talking About Family
introduction: This lesson involves a dialogue where one individual inquires about the other's family. It includes common questions and responses related to family members.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Cuéntame sobre tu familia.
story.translation: Tell me about your family.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Bueno, tengo dos hermanos y una hermana.
story.translation: Well, I have two brothers and one sister.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: ¿Eres el mayor o el menor?
story.translation: Are you the oldest or the youngest?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Soy el menor de todos.
story.translation: I'm the youngest of all.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: ¿Y tus padres? ¿Qué hacen?
story.translation: And your parents? What do they do?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Mi padre es médico y mi madre es profesora.
story.translation: My father is a doctor and my mother is a teacher.

lesson.title: Studies and Career Aspirations
introduction: This dialogue explores a conversation between two individuals discussing academic interests and future career goals.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: ¿Qué estudias actualmente?
story.translation: What are you studying currently?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Estudio ingeniería informática. Siempre me han fascinado las computadoras.
story.translation: I'm studying computer engineering. I've always been fascinated by computers.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Eso suena interesante. ¿Qué te gustaría hacer después de graduarte?
story.translation: That sounds interesting. What would you like to do after you graduate?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Me gustaría trabajar en el desarrollo de software o en la ciberseguridad.
story.translation: I would like to work in software development or cybersecurity.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Parece que tienes todo planeado. ¿Hay alguna empresa en particular en la que desees trabajar?
story.translation: It seems like you have everything planned out. Is there a particular company you wish to work for?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Sí, me encantaría trabajar para Google o Microsoft. Son mis empresas soñadas.
story.translation: Yes, I would love to work for Google or Microsoft. They are my dream companies.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Son metas ambiciosas, pero con tu dedicación, seguro que lo lograrás.
story.translation: Those are ambitious goals, but with your dedication, I'm sure you'll achieve them.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Gracias por tu apoyo. ¿Y tú? ¿Qué planes tienes para el futuro?
story.translation: Thank you for your support. And you? What plans do you have for the future?

tests.prompt: What would you like to do?

lesson.title: Language and Introductions
introduction: In this lesson, we'll cover a conversation between a man asking a local if they speak English, followed by self-introductions.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Bonjour, parlez-vous anglais?
story.translation: Hello, do you speak English?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Un peu, oui. Comment puis-je vous aider?
story.translation: A little, yes. How can I help you?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Je m'appelle John. Je suis américain.
story.translation: My name is John. I am American.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Enchanté, John. Je m'appelle Lucie.
story.translation: Pleased to meet you, John. My name is Lucie.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Enchanté, Lucie. C'est ma première fois en France.
story.translation: Pleased to meet you, Lucie. It's my first time in France.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Bienvenue en France! J'espère que vous apprécierez votre séjour.
story.translation: Welcome to France! I hope you will enjoy your stay.

lesson.title: Introducing Oneself
introduction: This lesson covers a conversation where someone introduces himself to a local in French.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Bonjour, je m'appelle Thomas. Je suis touriste ici.
story.translation: Hello, my name is Thomas. I am a tourist here.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Enchanté, Thomas! Je m'appelle Marie. D'où venez-vous?
story.translation: Pleased to meet you, Thomas! My name is Marie. Where are you from?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Je viens des États-Unis. Et vous, vous êtes d'ici?
story.translation: I come from the United States. And you, are you from here?

story.message: 'D'où venez-vous?' means 'Where do you come from?'. It's a common question when meeting someone new.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Oui, je suis née ici. Qu'est-ce qui vous amène dans notre ville?
story.translation: Yes, I was born here. What brings you to our city?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Je suis ici pour découvrir la culture et la cuisine françaises.
story.translation: I am here to discover the French culture and cuisine.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: C'est fantastique! Il y a beaucoup de choses à voir et à faire ici. Avez-vous besoin de recommandations?
story.translation: That's fantastic! There are many things to see and do here. Do you need any recommendations?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Oui, ce serait génial. Je cherche un bon restaurant français.
story.translation: Yes, that would be great. I am looking for a good French restaurant.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Je vous recommande le restaurant La Belle Époque. Il est à dix minutes d'ici à pied.
story.translation: I recommend the restaurant La Belle Époque. It is ten minutes from here on foot.

lesson.title: Checking Into a Hotel
introduction: In this lesson, we will learn how to check into a hotel in French.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Bonjour, j'ai une réservation au nom de Smith.
story.translation: Hello, I have a reservation under the name Smith.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Bien sûr, Monsieur Smith. Avez-vous votre passeport?
story.translation: Of course, Mr. Smith. Do you have your passport?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Oui, voici mon passeport.
story.translation: Yes, here is my passport.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Merci. Voici votre clé. Vous êtes dans la chambre 205.
story.translation: Thank you. Here is your key. You are in room 205.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: À quelle heure est le petit déjeuner?
story.translation: What time is breakfast?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Le petit déjeuner est servi de 7h à 10h.
story.translation: Breakfast is served from 7 AM to 10 AM.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Parfait, merci beaucoup.
story.translation: Perfect, thank you very much.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: De rien, Monsieur. Si vous avez besoin de quelque chose, appelez la réception.
story.translation: You're welcome, Sir. If you need anything, call the reception.

tests.answer: À quelle heure est le petit déjeuner?

lesson.title: Asking for Directions
introduction: In this lesson, we'll cover a simple exchange about asking for and giving directions in French.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Excusez-moi, pouvez-vous me dire comment aller à la gare, s'il vous plaît?
story.translation: Excuse me, can you tell me how to get to the train station, please?

story.message: 'Pouvez-vous' is a polite way of asking for help. It is the formal form of 'Can you' in French.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Bien sûr, continuez tout droit, puis prenez la deuxième rue à gauche.
story.translation: Of course, go straight ahead, then take the second street on the left.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Est-ce que c'est loin?
story.translation: Is it far?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Non, c'est à environ dix minutes à pied.
story.translation: No, it's about ten minutes by foot.

tests.prompt: How to get to the station?

lesson.title: Discovering Local Activities
introduction: In this lesson, we'll cover a conversation between a man and a local about finding activities to do in town.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Bonjour, je suis nouveau en ville. Qu'est-ce qu'il y a à faire ici?
story.translation: Hello, I am new in town. What is there to do here?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Bonjour! Il y a beaucoup à découvrir. Aimez-vous l'art ou la nature?
story.translation: Hello! There is a lot to discover. Do you like art or nature?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: J'aime beaucoup l'art. Y a-t-il des musées?
story.translation: I really like art. Are there any museums?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Oui, il y a le musée d'art moderne qui est très célèbre.
story.translation: Yes, there is the modern art museum which is very famous.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Et pour la nature?
story.translation: And for nature?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Vous pouvez visiter le parc national. Il y a de belles randonnées à faire.
story.translation: You can visit the national park. There are beautiful hikes to do.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Merci beaucoup pour les informations. Comment puis-je aller au musée d'art moderne?
story.translation: Thank you very much for the information. How can I get to the modern art museum?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Prenez le bus numéro 5, il vous déposera juste en face.
story.translation: Take bus number 5, it will drop you off right in front.

lesson.title: Asking About Languages
introduction: In this lesson, we'll cover a simple exchange about language skills, focusing on asking and answering about speaking English.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Hola, ¿hablas inglés?
story.translation: Hello, do you speak English?

story.message: Notice the inverted question mark '¿' at the beginning of questions in Spanish. 'Hablas' is the 'tú' form of the verb 'hablar', meaning 'to speak'.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Sí, hablo un poco.
story.translation: Yes, I speak a little.

story.message: 'Hablo' is the first person present tense of 'hablar', meaning 'I speak'.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: ¿De dónde eres?
story.translation: Where are you from?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Soy de España. ¿Y tú?
story.translation: I'm from Spain. And you?

story.message: 'Soy' is from the verb 'ser', meaning 'I am'. It is used here to indicate origin.

lesson.title: A Casual Meeting
introduction: This lesson presents a casual interaction between two individuals meeting for the first time. They greet each other, exchange pleasantries about their well-being, and share brief plans for their day.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Hola, ¿cómo estás?
story.translation: Hi, how are you?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Bien, gracias. ¿Y tú?
story.translation: Good, thanks. And you?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: También estoy bien. ¿Qué planes tienes para hoy?
story.translation: I'm also good. What plans do you have for today?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Voy a trabajar hasta el mediodía y luego iré al gimnasio. ¿Y tú?
story.translation: I'm going to work until noon and then I'll go to the gym. What about you?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Yo tengo clases toda la tarde, pero después planeo ver una película.
story.translation: I have classes all afternoon, but afterwards, I plan to watch a movie.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Suena como un buen plan. Disfruta tu día.
story.translation: Sounds like a good plan. Enjoy your day.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Igualmente. ¡Hasta luego!
story.translation: You too. See you later!

tests.prompt: I'm going to work until noon and then I'll go to the gym.
tests.answer: Voy a trabajar hasta el mediodía y luego iré al gimnasio.
What plans do you have for today?

lesson.title: First Meeting
introduction: This lesson covers a dialogue between two individuals who are meeting for the first time. The conversation includes basic greetings and introductory phrases.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Hola, ¿cómo te llamas?
story.translation: Hi, what's your name?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Hola, soy Ana. ¿Y tú?
story.translation: Hi, I'm Ana. And you?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Me llamo Carlos. Es un placer conocerte.
story.translation: My name is Carlos. It's a pleasure to meet you.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Igualmente, Carlos. ¿De dónde eres?
story.translation: Likewise, Carlos. Where are you from?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Soy de Madrid. ¿Y tú?
story.translation: I'm from Madrid. And you?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Soy de Barcelona. ¿Qué te trae por aquí?
story.translation: I'm from Barcelona. What brings you here?

tests.prompt: It's a pleasure to meet you.

lesson.title: Asking for Directions to the Train Station
introduction: This lesson focuses on a scenario where a traveler seeks assistance from a local to find the train station in a Spanish-speaking city, using key phrases and vocabulary for directions.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Disculpa, ¿me puedes decir cómo llegar a la estación de tren?
story.translation: Excuse me, can you tell me how to get to the train station?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Claro, sigue recto por esta calle dos cuadras, luego toma la primera a la derecha y continúa caminando. La estación estará a tu izquierda.
story.translation: Sure, go straight down this street for two blocks, then take the first right and keep walking. The station will be on your left.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: ¿Es muy lejos de aquí?
story.translation: Is it far from here?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: No, está a unos diez minutos caminando.
story.translation: No, it's about a ten-minute walk.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Perfecto, muchas gracias por tu ayuda.
story.translation: Perfect, thank you so much for your help.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: De nada, que tengas un buen día.
story.translation: You're welcome, have a good day.

tests.prompt: Excuse me, can you tell me how to get to the train station?
tests.answer: Disculpa, ¿me puedes decir cómo llegar a la estación de tren?

tests.prompt: Sure, go straight down this street for two blocks, then take the first right and keep walking.
tests.answer: Claro, sigue recto por esta calle dos cuadras, luego toma la primera a la derecha y continúa caminando.

tests.prompt: No, it's about a ten-minute walk.
tests.answer: No, está a unos diez minutos caminando.

tests.prompt: You're welcome, have a good day.
tests.answer: De nada, que tengas un buen día.

lesson.title: Discovering Local Activities
introduction: Engage in a conversation where a visitor asks a local about available activities around town. This dialogue introduces vocabulary for inquiring about leisure options and understanding suggestions.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Hola, estoy buscando algo interesante que hacer en la ciudad. ¿Tienes alguna recomendación?
story.translation: Hi, I'm looking for something interesting to do in town. Do you have any recommendations?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Claro, ¿qué te interesa más? ¿Arte, deporte, comida?
story.translation: Sure, what are you more interested in? Art, sports, food?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Me gusta el arte y la cultura. ¿Hay alguna exposición o museo que debería visitar?
story.translation: I like art and culture. Is there an exhibition or museum I should visit?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Definitivamente deberías visitar el Museo de Arte Contemporáneo. También hay una exposición de fotografía en el centro cultural esta semana.
story.translation: You should definitely visit the Museum of Contemporary Art. There's also a photography exhibition at the cultural center this week.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Eso suena perfecto. ¿Cómo puedo llegar al centro cultural?
story.translation: That sounds perfect. How can I get to the cultural center?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Es fácil, está a solo diez minutos a pie desde aquí. Solo sigue esta calle hasta el parque y gira a la izquierda.
story.translation: It's easy, it's just a ten-minute walk from here. Just follow this street to the park and turn left.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Genial, gracias por la información. ¿Hay algún café cerca de allí donde pueda tomar algo después?
story.translation: Great, thanks for the information. Is there a café nearby where I can grab something afterwards?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Sí, justo al lado del centro cultural hay un café muy acogedor llamado 'Café del Arte'. Tienen excelentes pasteles.
story.translation: Yes, right next to the cultural center there's a very cozy café called 'Café del Arte'. They have excellent pastries.

tests.prompt: Hi, I'm looking for something interesting to do in town. Do you have any recommendations?
tests.answer: Hola, estoy buscando algo interesante que hacer en la ciudad. ¿Tienes alguna recomendación?

tests.prompt: You should definitely visit the Museum of Contemporary Art.
tests.answer: Definitivamente deberías visitar el Museo de Arte Contemporáneo.

tests.prompt: How can I get to the cultural center?
Is there a café nearby where I can grab something afterwards?
tests.answer: ¿Hay algún café cerca de allí donde pueda tomar algo después?

tests.prompt: Right next to the cultural center there's a very cozy café called 'Café del Arte'.
tests.answer: Sí, justo al lado del centro cultural hay un café muy acogedor llamado 'Café del Arte'.

lesson.title: Grocery Shopping Request
introduction: This lesson involves a conversation where someone asks a friend to pick up several items from the grocery store, emphasizing the use of numbers and quantities.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Hola, ¿puedes comprar algunas cosas para mí en la tienda? Necesito tres manzanas, dos litros de leche y un paquete de arroz.
story.translation: Hi, can you buy some things for me at the store? I need three apples, two liters of milk, and one package of rice.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Claro, ¿alguna marca en particular para la leche o el arroz?
story.translation: Sure, any particular brand for the milk or rice?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Para la leche, prefiero la marca 'Lácteos del Campo', y para el arroz, cualquier marca está bien.
story.translation: For the milk, I prefer the 'Lácteos del Campo' brand, and for the rice, any brand is fine.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Entendido. ¿Necesitas algo más?
story.translation: Understood. Do you need anything else?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Sí, por favor, añade cinco plátanos y un kilo de tomates.
story.translation: Yes, please add five bananas and one kilo of tomatoes.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Perfecto, ¿te lo llevo a casa o lo dejo en tu oficina?
story.translation: Perfect, should I bring it to your home or leave it at your office?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Por favor, tráelo a mi casa. Gracias por la ayuda.
story.translation: Please bring it to my house. Thanks for the help.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: De nada, lo haré enseguida.
story.translation: You're welcome, I'll do it right away.

lesson.title: Ordering at a Local Café
introduction: This lesson simulates a situation where a customer orders food and coffee in a Spanish-speaking café. It introduces relevant vocabulary for menu items, making orders, and interacting with café staff.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Buenos días, me gustaría pedir un café con leche y un croissant de almendras, por favor.
story.translation: Good morning, I would like to order a coffee with milk and an almond croissant, please.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Claro, ¿desea algo más?
story.translation: Of course, would you like anything else?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Sí, también quisiera un vaso de agua.
story.translation: Yes, I would also like a glass of water.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Perfecto. ¿Para tomar aquí o para llevar?
story.translation: Perfect. For here or to go?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Para aquí, gracias.
story.translation: For here, thank you.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Muy bien, enseguida le traigo su pedido.
story.translation: Very well, I'll bring your order right away.

tests.prompt: Good morning, I would like to order a coffee with milk and an almond croissant, please.
tests.answer: Buenos días, me gustaría pedir un café con leche y un croissant de almendras, por favor.
Of course, would you like anything else?

tests.prompt: Yes, I would also like a glass of water.
tests.answer: Sí, también quisiera un vaso de agua.

tests.prompt: Very well, I'll bring your order right away.
tests.answer: Muy bien, enseguida le traigo su pedido.

lesson.title: Ordering Breakfast at a Cafe
introduction: This lesson revolves around a dialogue in which an individual orders breakfast at a café, covering common phrases used when ordering food and drinks.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Buenos días, ¿me puede dar el menú de desayuno, por favor?
story.translation: Good morning, can you give me the breakfast menu, please?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Por supuesto, aquí tiene. ¿Desea algo para beber?
story.translation: Of course, here you go. Would you like something to drink?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Sí, quisiera un café con leche y un vaso de agua, gracias.
story.translation: Yes, I would like a coffee with milk and a glass of water, thank you.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Muy bien, ¿y qué le gustaría de comer?
story.translation: Very well, and what would you like to eat?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Estoy entre el pan con tomate y el desayuno americano. ¿Cuál me recomienda?
story.translation: I'm torn between the bread with tomato and the American breakfast. Which do you recommend?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Ambos son muy buenos, pero el desayuno americano es el más popular.
story.translation: Both are very good, but the American breakfast is the most popular.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Entonces tomaré el desayuno americano, por favor.
story.translation: Then I'll have the American breakfast, please.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Excelente elección. ¿Cómo desea sus huevos?
story.translation: Excellent choice. How would you like your eggs?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Revueltos, por favor. Y también, ¿podría traerme un poco de mermelada para el pan?
story.translation: Scrambled, please. And also, could you bring me some jam for the bread?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Por supuesto, enseguida le traigo su desayuno.
story.translation: Of course, I'll bring your breakfast right away.

tests.answer: How would you like your eggs?

lesson.title: Ordering Drinks at a Bar
introduction: This lesson follows a dialogue between a customer and a bartender, focusing on ordering different types of drinks and asking about bar specials.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Buenas noches, ¿qué cervezas tienen?
story.translation: Good evening, what beers do you have?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Tenemos cervezas locales e importadas. ¿Prefieres alguna?
story.translation: We have local and imported beers. Do you have a preference?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Me gustaría una cerveza local, por favor.
story.translation: I'd like a local beer, please.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: ¿Alguna marca en particular?
story.translation: Any particular brand?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: ¿Cuál me recomiendas?
story.translation: Which one do you recommend?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: La cerveza 'Estrella Montaña' es muy popular aquí.
story.translation: 'Estrella Montaña' beer is very popular here.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Perfecto, tomaré una de esas. ¿Tienen también vinos?
story.translation: Perfect, I'll have one of those. Do you also have wines?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Sí, tenemos una selección de vinos blancos y tintos. ¿Te interesa alguno?
story.translation: Yes, we have a selection of white and red wines. Are you interested in any?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Una copa de vino tinto, por favor. ¿Qué snacks recomiendas?
story.translation: A glass of red wine, please. What snacks do you recommend?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Las aceitunas y el queso manchego van muy bien con el vino tinto.
story.translation: Olives and Manchego cheese go very well with red wine.

lesson.title: Asking Someone on a Date
introduction: This lesson unfolds a scenario where one individual expresses interest in going out on a date with another. It encompasses expressions of interest, making invitations, and responding politely.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Hola, ¿tienes planes para este fin de semana?
story.translation: Hi, do you have plans for this weekend?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: No, aún no tengo planes. ¿Por qué?
story.translation: No, I don't have plans yet. Why?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Me preguntaba si te gustaría ir a cenar conmigo.
story.translation: I was wondering if you would like to have dinner with me.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Eso suena genial. Me encantaría.
story.translation: That sounds great. I would love to.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: ¿Qué te parece si nos encontramos a las ocho en el restaurante La Estrella?
story.translation: How about we meet at eight at La Estrella restaurant?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Perfecto, nos vemos el sábado entonces.
story.translation: Perfect, see you on Saturday then.

tests.prompt: do you have plans for this weekend?
tests.answer: ¿tienes planes para este fin de semana?

tests.answer: ¿Qué te parece si nos encontramos a las ocho

lesson.title: Talking About Family
introduction: This lesson involves a dialogue where one individual inquires about the other's family. It includes common questions and responses related to family members.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Cuéntame sobre tu familia.
story.translation: Tell me about your family.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Bueno, tengo dos hermanos y una hermana.
story.translation: Well, I have two brothers and one sister.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: ¿Eres el mayor o el menor?
story.translation: Are you the oldest or the youngest?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Soy el menor de todos.
story.translation: I'm the youngest of all.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: ¿Y tus padres? ¿Qué hacen?
story.translation: And your parents? What do they do?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Mi padre es médico y mi madre es profesora.
story.translation: My father is a doctor and my mother is a teacher.

lesson.title: Studies and Career Aspirations
introduction: This dialogue explores a conversation between two individuals discussing academic interests and future career goals.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: ¿Qué estudias actualmente?
story.translation: What are you studying currently?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Estudio ingeniería informática. Siempre me han fascinado las computadoras.
story.translation: I'm studying computer engineering. I've always been fascinated by computers.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Eso suena interesante. ¿Qué te gustaría hacer después de graduarte?
story.translation: That sounds interesting. What would you like to do after you graduate?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Me gustaría trabajar en el desarrollo de software o en la ciberseguridad.
story.translation: I would like to work in software development or cybersecurity.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Parece que tienes todo planeado. ¿Hay alguna empresa en particular en la que desees trabajar?
story.translation: It seems like you have everything planned out. Is there a particular company you wish to work for?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Sí, me encantaría trabajar para Google o Microsoft. Son mis empresas soñadas.
story.translation: Yes, I would love to work for Google or Microsoft. They are my dream companies.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Son metas ambiciosas, pero con tu dedicación, seguro que lo lograrás.
story.translation: Those are ambitious goals, but with your dedication, I'm sure you'll achieve them.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Gracias por tu apoyo. ¿Y tú? ¿Qué planes tienes para el futuro?
story.translation: Thank you for your support. And you? What plans do you have for the future?

tests.prompt: What would you like to do?

lesson.title: Asking About Languages
introduction: In this lesson, we'll cover a simple exchange about language skills, focusing on asking and answering about speaking English.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Hola, ¿hablas inglés?
story.translation: Hello, do you speak English?

story.message: Notice the inverted question mark '¿' at the beginning of questions in Spanish. 'Hablas' is the 'tú' form of the verb 'hablar', meaning 'to speak'.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Sí, hablo un poco.
story.translation: Yes, I speak a little.

story.message: 'Hablo' is the first person present tense of 'hablar', meaning 'I speak'.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: ¿De dónde eres?
story.translation: Where are you from?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Soy de España. ¿Y tú?
story.translation: I'm from Spain. And you?

story.message: 'Soy' is from the verb 'ser', meaning 'I am'. It is used here to indicate origin.

lesson.title: A Casual Meeting
introduction: This lesson presents a casual interaction between two individuals meeting for the first time. They greet each other, exchange pleasantries about their well-being, and share brief plans for their day.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Hola, ¿cómo estás?
story.translation: Hi, how are you?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Bien, gracias. ¿Y tú?
story.translation: Good, thanks. And you?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: También estoy bien. ¿Qué planes tienes para hoy?
story.translation: I'm also good. What plans do you have for today?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Voy a trabajar hasta el mediodía y luego iré al gimnasio. ¿Y tú?
story.translation: I'm going to work until noon and then I'll go to the gym. What about you?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Yo tengo clases toda la tarde, pero después planeo ver una película.
story.translation: I have classes all afternoon, but afterwards, I plan to watch a movie.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Suena como un buen plan. Disfruta tu día.
story.translation: Sounds like a good plan. Enjoy your day.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Igualmente. ¡Hasta luego!
story.translation: You too. See you later!

tests.prompt: I'm going to work until noon and then I'll go to the gym.
tests.answer: Voy a trabajar hasta el mediodía y luego iré al gimnasio.
What plans do you have for today?

story.speaker: speaker1

story.translation: Carlos, I want to introduce you to my friend, Sofia. Sofia, this is Carlos.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Mucho gusto, Sofía. ¿De dónde eres?
story.translation: Nice to meet you, Sofia. Where are you from?

story.message: El gusto es mío, Carlos. Soy de Colombia.
story.translation: The pleasure is mine, Carlos. I'm from Colombia.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Sofía estudia arte aquí en la ciudad, y Carlos es ingeniero.
story.translation: Sofia studies art here in the city, and Carlos is an engineer.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Interesante. ¿Qué tipo de arte te gusta, Sofía?
story.translation: Interesting. What kind of art do you like, Sofia?

story.speaker: speaker3
story.message: Me encanta la pintura y la escultura, especialmente del Renacimiento.
story.translation: I love painting and sculpture, especially from the Renaissance.

lesson.title: Asking for Directions to the Train Station
introduction: This lesson focuses on a scenario where a traveler seeks assistance from a local to find the train station in a Spanish-speaking city, using key phrases and vocabulary for directions.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Disculpa, ¿me puedes decir cómo llegar a la estación de tren?
story.translation: Excuse me, can you tell me how to get to the train station?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Claro, sigue recto por esta calle dos cuadras, luego toma la primera a la derecha y continúa caminando. La estación estará a tu izquierda.
story.translation: Sure, go straight down this street for two blocks, then take the first right and keep walking. The station will be on your left.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: ¿Es muy lejos de aquí?
story.translation: Is it far from here?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: No, está a unos diez minutos caminando.
story.translation: No, it's about a ten-minute walk.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Perfecto, muchas gracias por tu ayuda.
story.translation: Perfect, thank you so much for your help.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: De nada, que tengas un buen día.
story.translation: You're welcome, have a good day.

tests.answer: Disculpa, ¿me puedes decir cómo llegar a la estación de tren?

tests.answer: Claro, sigue recto por esta calle dos cuadras, luego toma la primera a la derecha y continúa caminando.

tests.prompt: No, it's about a ten-minute walk.
tests.answer: No, está a unos diez minutos caminando.

tests.prompt: You're welcome, have a good day.
tests.answer: De nada, que tengas un buen día.

lesson.title: Discovering Local Activities
introduction: Engage in a conversation where a visitor asks a local about available activities around town. This dialogue introduces vocabulary for inquiring about leisure options and understanding suggestions.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Hola, estoy buscando algo interesante que hacer en la ciudad. ¿Tienes alguna recomendación?
story.translation: Hi, I'm looking for something interesting to do in town. Do you have any recommendations?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Claro, ¿qué te interesa más? ¿Arte, deporte, comida?
story.translation: Sure, what are you more interested in? Art, sports, food?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Me gusta el arte y la cultura. ¿Hay alguna exposición o museo que debería visitar?
story.translation: I like art and culture. Is there an exhibition or museum I should visit?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Definitivamente deberías visitar el Museo de Arte Contemporáneo. También hay una exposición de fotografía en el centro cultural esta semana.
story.translation: You should definitely visit the Museum of Contemporary Art. There's also a photography exhibition at the cultural center this week.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Eso suena perfecto. ¿Cómo puedo llegar al centro cultural?
story.translation: That sounds perfect. How can I get to the cultural center?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Es fácil, está a solo diez minutos a pie desde aquí. Solo sigue esta calle hasta el parque y gira a la izquierda.
story.translation: It's easy, it's just a ten-minute walk from here. Just follow this street to the park and turn left.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Genial, gracias por la información. ¿Hay algún café cerca de allí donde pueda tomar algo después?
story.translation: Great, thanks for the information. Is there a café nearby where I can grab something afterwards?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Sí, justo al lado del centro cultural hay un café muy acogedor llamado 'Café del Arte'. Tienen excelentes pasteles.
story.translation: Yes, right next to the cultural center there's a very cozy café called 'Café del Arte'. They have excellent pastries.

tests.prompt: Hi, I'm looking for something interesting to do in town. Do you have any recommendations?
tests.answer: Hola, estoy buscando algo interesante que hacer en la ciudad. ¿Tienes alguna recomendación?

tests.prompt: You should definitely visit the Museum of Contemporary Art.
tests.answer: Definitivamente deberías visitar el Museo de Arte Contemporáneo.

tests.prompt: How can I get to the cultural center?
Is there a café nearby where I can grab something afterwards?
tests.answer: ¿Hay algún café cerca de allí donde pueda tomar algo después?

tests.prompt: Right next to the cultural center there's a very cozy café called 'Café del Arte'.
tests.answer: Sí, justo al lado del centro cultural hay un café muy acogedor llamado 'Café del Arte'.

lesson.title: Grocery Shopping Request
introduction: This lesson involves a conversation where someone asks a friend to pick up several items from the grocery store, emphasizing the use of numbers and quantities.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Hola, ¿puedes comprar algunas cosas para mí en la tienda? Necesito tres manzanas, dos litros de leche y un paquete de arroz.
story.translation: Hi, can you buy some things for me at the store? I need three apples, two liters of milk, and one package of rice.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Claro, ¿alguna marca en particular para la leche o el arroz?
story.translation: Sure, any particular brand for the milk or rice?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Para la leche, prefiero la marca 'Lácteos del Campo', y para el arroz, cualquier marca está bien.
story.translation: For the milk, I prefer the 'Lácteos del Campo' brand, and for the rice, any brand is fine.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Entendido. ¿Necesitas algo más?
story.translation: Understood. Do you need anything else?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Sí, por favor, añade cinco plátanos y un kilo de tomates.
story.translation: Yes, please add five bananas and one kilo of tomatoes.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Perfecto, ¿te lo llevo a casa o lo dejo en tu oficina?
story.translation: Perfect, should I bring it to your home or leave it at your office?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Por favor, tráelo a mi casa. Gracias por la ayuda.
story.translation: Please bring it to my house. Thanks for the help.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: De nada, lo haré enseguida.
story.translation: You're welcome, I'll do it right away.

lesson.title: Ordering at a Local Café
introduction: This lesson simulates a situation where a customer orders food and coffee in a Spanish-speaking café. It introduces relevant vocabulary for menu items, making orders, and interacting with café staff.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Buenos días, me gustaría pedir un café con leche y un croissant de almendras, por favor.
story.translation: Good morning, I would like to order a coffee with milk and an almond croissant, please.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Claro, ¿desea algo más?
story.translation: Of course, would you like anything else?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Sí, también quisiera un vaso de agua.
story.translation: Yes, I would also like a glass of water.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Perfecto. ¿Para tomar aquí o para llevar?
story.translation: Perfect. For here or to go?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Para aquí, gracias.
story.translation: For here, thank you.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Muy bien, enseguida le traigo su pedido.
story.translation: Very well, I'll bring your order right away.

tests.prompt: Good morning, I would like to order a coffee with milk and an almond croissant, please.
tests.answer: Buenos días, me gustaría pedir un café con leche y un croissant de almendras, por favor.
Of course, would you like anything else?

tests.prompt: Yes, I would also like a glass of water.
tests.answer: Sí, también quisiera un vaso de agua.

tests.prompt: Very well, I'll bring your order right away.
tests.answer: Muy bien, enseguida le traigo su pedido.

lesson.title: Asking About Languages
introduction: In this lesson, we'll cover a simple exchange about language skills, focusing on asking and answering about speaking English.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Hola, ¿hablas inglés?
story.translation: Hello, do you speak English?

story.message: Notice the inverted question mark '¿' at the beginning of questions in Spanish. 'Hablas' is the 'tú' form of the verb 'hablar', meaning 'to speak'.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Sí, hablo un poco.
story.translation: Yes, I speak a little.

story.message: 'Hablo' is the first person present tense of 'hablar', meaning 'I speak'.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: ¿De dónde eres?
story.translation: Where are you from?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Soy de España. ¿Y tú?
story.translation: I'm from Spain. And you?

story.message: 'Soy' is from the verb 'ser', meaning 'I am'. It is used here to indicate origin.

lesson.title: A Casual Meeting
introduction: This lesson presents a casual interaction between two individuals meeting for the first time. They greet each other, exchange pleasantries about their well-being, and share brief plans for their day.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Hola, ¿cómo estás?
story.translation: Hi, how are you?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Bien, gracias. ¿Y tú?
story.translation: Good, thanks. And you?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: También estoy bien. ¿Qué planes tienes para hoy?
story.translation: I'm also good. What plans do you have for today?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Voy a trabajar hasta el mediodía y luego iré al gimnasio. ¿Y tú?
story.translation: I'm going to work until noon and then I'll go to the gym. What about you?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Yo tengo clases toda la tarde, pero después planeo ver una película.
story.translation: I have classes all afternoon, but afterwards, I plan to watch a movie.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Suena como un buen plan. Disfruta tu día.
story.translation: Sounds like a good plan. Enjoy your day.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Igualmente. ¡Hasta luego!
story.translation: You too. See you later!

tests.prompt: I'm going to work until noon and then I'll go to the gym.
tests.answer: Voy a trabajar hasta el mediodía y luego iré al gimnasio.
What plans do you have for today?

lesson.title: Introducing Friends
introduction: This lesson covers a scenario where an individual introduces a new acquaintance to a friend. It highlights polite introductions and expressions used in social settings.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Carlos, te quiero presentar a mi amiga, Sofía. Sofía, él es Carlos.
story.translation: Carlos, I want to introduce you to my friend, Sofia. Sofia, this is Carlos.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Mucho gusto, Sofía. ¿De dónde eres?
story.translation: Nice to meet you, Sofia. Where are you from?

story.speaker: speaker3
story.message: El gusto es mío, Carlos. Soy de Colombia.
story.translation: The pleasure is mine, Carlos. I'm from Colombia.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Sofía estudia arte aquí en la ciudad, y Carlos es ingeniero.
story.translation: Sofia studies art here in the city, and Carlos is an engineer.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Interesante. ¿Qué tipo de arte te gusta, Sofía?
story.translation: Interesting. What kind of art do you like, Sofia?

story.speaker: speaker3
story.message: Me encanta la pintura y la escultura, especialmente del Renacimiento.
story.translation: I love painting and sculpture, especially from the Renaissance.

tests.prompt: Carlos, I want to introduce you to my friend, Sofia.
tests.answer: Carlos, te quiero presentar a mi amiga, Sofía.

tests.prompt: Nice to meet you, Sofia. Where are you from?
The pleasure is mine, Carlos. I'm from Colombia.
tests.answer: El gusto es mío, Carlos. Soy de Colombia.

tests.prompt: What kind of art do you like, Sofia?
tests.answer: ¿Qué tipo de arte te gusta, Sofía?

tests.prompt: I love painting and sculpture, especially from the Renaissance.
tests.answer: Me encanta la pintura y la escultura, especialmente del Renacimiento.

lesson.title: Asking for Directions to the Train Station
introduction: This lesson focuses on a scenario where a traveler seeks assistance from a local to find the train station in a Spanish-speaking city, using key phrases and vocabulary for directions.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Disculpa, ¿me puedes decir cómo llegar a la estación de tren?
story.translation: Excuse me, can you tell me how to get to the train station?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Claro, sigue recto por esta calle dos cuadras, luego toma la primera a la derecha y continúa caminando. La estación estará a tu izquierda.
story.translation: Sure, go straight down this street for two blocks, then take the first right and keep walking. The station will be on your left.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: ¿Es muy lejos de aquí?
story.translation: Is it far from here?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: No, está a unos diez minutos caminando.
story.translation: No, it's about a ten-minute walk.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Perfecto, muchas gracias por tu ayuda.
story.translation: Perfect, thank you so much for your help.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: De nada, que tengas un buen día.
story.translation: You're welcome, have a good day.

tests.prompt: Excuse me, can you tell me how to get to the train station?
tests.answer: Disculpa, ¿me puedes decir cómo llegar a la estación de tren?

tests.answer: Claro, sigue recto por esta calle dos cuadras, luego toma la primera a la derecha y continúa caminando.

tests.prompt: No, it's about a ten-minute walk.
tests.answer: No, está a unos diez minutos caminando.

tests.prompt: You're welcome, have a good day.
tests.answer: De nada, que tengas un buen día.

lesson.title: Discovering Local Activities
introduction: Engage in a conversation where a visitor asks a local about available activities around town. This dialogue introduces vocabulary for inquiring about leisure options and understanding suggestions.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Hola, estoy buscando algo interesante que hacer en la ciudad. ¿Tienes alguna recomendación?
story.translation: Hi, I'm looking for something interesting to do in town. Do you have any recommendations?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Claro, ¿qué te interesa más? ¿Arte, deporte, comida?
story.translation: Sure, what are you more interested in? Art, sports, food?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Me gusta el arte y la cultura. ¿Hay alguna exposición o museo que debería visitar?
story.translation: I like art and culture. Is there an exhibition or museum I should visit?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Definitivamente deberías visitar el Museo de Arte Contemporáneo. También hay una exposición de fotografía en el centro cultural esta semana.
story.translation: You should definitely visit the Museum of Contemporary Art. There's also a photography exhibition at the cultural center this week.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Eso suena perfecto. ¿Cómo puedo llegar al centro cultural?
story.translation: That sounds perfect. How can I get to the cultural center?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Es fácil, está a solo diez minutos a pie desde aquí. Solo sigue esta calle hasta el parque y gira a la izquierda.
story.translation: It's easy, it's just a ten-minute walk from here. Just follow this street to the park and turn left.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Genial, gracias por la información. ¿Hay algún café cerca de allí donde pueda tomar algo después?
story.translation: Great, thanks for the information. Is there a café nearby where I can grab something afterwards?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Sí, justo al lado del centro cultural hay un café muy acogedor llamado 'Café del Arte'. Tienen excelentes pasteles.
story.translation: Yes, right next to the cultural center there's a very cozy café called 'Café del Arte'. They have excellent pastries.

tests.prompt: Hi, I'm looking for something interesting to do in town. Do you have any recommendations?
tests.answer: Hola, estoy buscando algo interesante que hacer en la ciudad. ¿Tienes alguna recomendación?

tests.prompt: You should definitely visit the Museum of Contemporary Art.
tests.answer: Definitivamente deberías visitar el Museo de Arte Contemporáneo.

tests.prompt: How can I get to the cultural center?
Is there a café nearby where I can grab something afterwards?
tests.answer: ¿Hay algún café cerca de allí donde pueda tomar algo después?

tests.prompt: Right next to the cultural center there's a very cozy café called 'Café del Arte'.
tests.answer: Sí, justo al lado del centro cultural hay un café muy acogedor llamado 'Café del Arte'.

lesson.title: Ordering at a Local Café
introduction: This lesson simulates a situation where a customer orders food and coffee in a Spanish-speaking café. It introduces relevant vocabulary for menu items, making orders, and interacting with café staff.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Buenos días, me gustaría pedir un café con leche y un croissant de almendras, por favor.
story.translation: Good morning, I would like to order a coffee with milk and an almond croissant, please.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Claro, ¿desea algo más?
story.translation: Of course, would you like anything else?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Sí, también quisiera un vaso de agua.
story.translation: Yes, I would also like a glass of water.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Perfecto. ¿Para tomar aquí o para llevar?
story.translation: Perfect. For here or to go?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Para aquí, gracias.
story.translation: For here, thank you.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Muy bien, enseguida le traigo su pedido.
story.translation: Very well, I'll bring your order right away.

tests.prompt: Good morning, I would like to order a coffee with milk and an almond croissant, please.
tests.answer: Buenos días, me gustaría pedir un café con leche y un croissant de almendras, por favor.
Of course, would you like anything else?

tests.prompt: Yes, I would also like a glass of water.
tests.answer: Sí, también quisiera un vaso de agua.

tests.prompt: Very well, I'll bring your order right away.
tests.answer: Muy bien, enseguida le traigo su pedido.
